sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"准确的，正确的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: accurate, exact, precise, right, true, correct
means: accurate ：指通过谨慎的努力达到符合事实或实际，侧重不同程度的准确性，与事实无出入。
exact ：着重在质与量方面的准确，语气比accurate强。
precise ：侧重极端准确，更强调细节的精确无误。
right ：使用广泛，可与这些词中的correct换用，但常暗示道德、理解、行动等方面的正确。
true ：暗指绝对准确，尤指复制品与原件丝毫不差。
correct ：最常用词，主要指按一定标准或规则来衡量，没有谬误和差错或无缺点错误。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"纠正，改正"之意。
means: correct ： 指纠正或改正不正确、不真实或有缺点的东西。
rectify ： 正式用词，意义较抽象，侧重指彻底改正偏离子正确标准或规则的东西。
remedy ： 正式用词，通常指在局部范围内进行纠正，尤指对困难或棘手问题的解决。
revise ： 指通过仔细阅读、反复思考后而进行改正、订正或修订，使趋于完善。
amend ： 书面语用词。指进行更正或改变，使之更好，符合更高的要求。

sentence.Network_en: "That is correct, Meg," he answered in his cold, dead voice.
sentence.Network_cn: “没错，梅格。”他用冰冷、阴沉的声音答道。

sentence.Network_en: The club specialises in videoing its student golfers to correct their faults.
sentence.Network_cn: 俱乐部专门为高尔夫学员制作录像，以纠正他们的错误。

sentence.Network_en: The correct answers can be found at the bottom of page 8.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): from Latin correct- 'made straight, amended', from the verb corrigere, from cor- 'together' + regere 'guide'. The adjective is via French

entry.def: If something is correct, it is in accordance with the facts and has no mistakes.

example.ex: The correct answers can be found at the bottom of page 8...
The following information was correct at time of going to press...
example.tran: 下列信息在付印时准确无误。

entry.def: If someone is correct, what they have said or thought is true.

example.ex: You are absolutely correct. The leaves are from a bay tree...
example.tran: 你说得很对，这是月桂树的叶子。

example.ex: If Casey is correct, the total cost of the cleanup would come to $110 billion.
example.tran: 如果凯西是对的，清理的总花费将达1,100亿美元。

entry.def: The correct thing or method is the thing or method that is required or is most suitable in a particular situation.

example.ex: The use of the correct materials was crucial...
example.tran: 使用恰当的材料至关重要。

example.ex: White was in no doubt the referee made the correct decision.
example.tran: 怀特确信裁判作出了公正的判罚。

entry.def: If you say that someone is correct in doing something, you approve of their action.

example.ex: You are perfectly correct in trying to steer your mother towards increased independence...
example.tran: 你试图让自己的母亲变得越来越独立，这样做很正确。

example.ex: I think the president was correct to reject the offer.
example.tran: 我认为总统拒绝这一提议是正确的。

entry.tran: 纠正(问题);改正，修正(错误)
entry.def: If you correct a problem, mistake, or fault, you do something which puts it right.

example.ex: He may need surgery to correct the problem...
example.tran: 要解决这个问题，他可能需要做外科手术。

example.ex: He has criticised the government for inefficiency and delays in correcting past mistakes.
example.tran: 他批评政府在纠正过去的错误问题上效率低下，并且拖拖拉拉。

entry.def: If you correct someone, you say something which you think is more accurate or appropriate than what they have just said.

example.ex: 'Actually, that isn't what happened,' George corrects me...
example.tran: “实际上，并不是那样，”乔治纠正我。

example.ex: I must correct him on a minor point.
example.tran: 我必须纠正他的一处小错误。

entry.def: When someone corrects a piece of writing, they look at it and mark the mistakes in it.

example.ex: It took an extraordinary effort to focus on preparing his classes or correcting his students' work.
example.tran: 备课和批改学生的作业花费了他很多精力。

entry.tran: (行为)符合社会公认标准的，得体的
entry.def: If a person or their behaviour is correct, their behaviour is in accordance with social or other rules.

example.ex: I think English men are very polite and very correct...
example.tran: 我认为英国人很有礼貌，举止非常得体。

example.ex: We were rather surprised by their sporting and correct behaviour.
example.tran: 他们富有体育精神而且举止得体，让我们感到相当惊讶。

entry.tran: 若是我说错了就请指出
entry.def: You say 'correct me if I'm wrong' to indicate that you are not entirely sure that what you are about to say is true.

example.ex: As I recall, but correct me if I'm wrong, it was in a car park in Carmarthen.
example.tran: 如果我没记错的话，那是在卡马森的一个停车场内。

sentences.sentence: "right a wrongs done to the victims of the Holocaust"
"She chastised him for his insensitive remarks"
"engineers will work to correct the effects or air resistance"

means.word_mean: 5. punish in order to gain control or enforce obedience;

sentences.sentence: "The teacher disciplined the pupils rather frequently"

means.word_mean: 7. alter or regulate so as to achieve accuracy or conform to a standard;

sentences.sentence: "correct the alignment of the front wheels"
"The new contact lenses will correct for his myopia"

means.word_mean: 1. free from error; especially conforming to fact or truth;

sentences.sentence: "it isn't right to leave the party without saying goodbye"

means.word_mean: 3. in accord with accepted standards of usage or procedure;

auth_sentence.content: This argument is correct, on its own terms.
auth_sentence.res_content: This argument is correct, on its own terms.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This argument is correct, on its own terms.

auth_sentence.content: In hindsight, this is only two thirds correct.
auth_sentence.res_content: In hindsight, this is only two thirds correct.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In hindsight, this is only two thirds correct.

auth_sentence.content: In a perfect world your scenario would be correct.
auth_sentence.res_content: In a perfect world your scenario would be correct.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In a perfect world your scenario would be correct.

stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+direct直接的→adj.间接的, 迂回的
di离开+rect正,直→直接离开→径直的→指向，针对→管理，指导
direct直接的+ly表副词→adv.直接地, 立即
correct[v.改正,纠正]+itude状态→纠正后的状态
correct[v.改正,纠正]+ive表名词→n.矫正物, 中和物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 方向, 指导, 趋势
stems_affixes.word_buile: direct直接的;指导;指向+ion动作或状态→n.方向, 指导, 趋势

stems_affixes.value_cn: 主任, 主管, 导演
stems_affixes.word_buile: direct直接的+or人或物器→n.主任, 主管, 导演
rect正,直+angle角→[四个角]都是直角→矩形
rect正,直+itude状态→正直的状态→诚实,正直
di离开+rect正,直→直接离开→径直的→指向，针对→管理，指导
rect正,直+ify……化→使……正直→改正[错误]

Sentence.sentence: Confronted with such facts,some Swedish activists and legislators are demanding more extreme and far-reaching measures, such as replacing male and female pronouns with a neutral alternative and monitoring children more closely to correct them when they gravitate(被吸引) toward gendered play.
If the employees were already aware of their deficiencies before the evaluation period, however, they may be unable or unwilling to correct them

sentences.en: The thing turned out to be correct.
It is correct for you to keep it secret.
sentences.cn: 你不把事情说出来是对的。

jushi.english: The above principles are the only correct policy for solving this problem.
jushi.chinese: 只有上述原则才是解决这个问题的正确方针。

jushi.english: She is a correct young lady.
jushi.chinese: 她是一个品行高尚的年轻女士。

jushi.english: The correct thing to do is to say “sorry” to him.
jushi.chinese: 正确的做法是对他说声“对不起”。
